intro: Hibbertia graniticola, commonly known as the granite lily, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often on granite outcrops. Hibbertia graniticola is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its resilience in arid conditions. Its unique appearance and habitat make it a notable species in the region's flora.
